questions.question: Which of the following is NOT one of the main bones involved in cranial vault techniques?
What is the purpose of the frontal lift technique?
choices: To release restrictions in the frontal bone
questions.answer: To release restrictions in the frontal bone

questions.question: Which suture connects the frontal bone to the parietal bones?
What is the shape of the sphenoid bone?
Which technique is believed to affect the entire cranial system due to the bone's central role?
What structures are housed within the temporal bones?
Which joint is formed by the articulation of the temporal bone with the mandible?
What is the primary purpose of the sutures in the skull?
choices: To provide blood supply to the scalp
To allow for slight movement and flexibility of the skull
questions.answer: To allow for slight movement and flexibility of the skull

questions.question: Which traditional Timorese practice is similar to cranial vault techniques?
What is the recommended pressure for cranial vault techniques?
choices: About the weight of a nickel
questions.answer: About the weight of a nickel

questions.question: Which bone houses the pituitary gland?
What is the primary goal of the parietal lift technique?
choices: To release tension in the sagittal suture
questions.answer: To release tension in the sagittal suture

questions.question: Which condition is NOT typically associated with temporal bone techniques?
What is the correct hand placement for the frontal lift technique?
choices: Thumbs on frontal bone, fingers supporting occiput
Palms on parietal bones, fingers interlaced at vertex
Fingertips at greater wings of sphenoid
Fingertips on temporal bones near ears
questions.answer: Thumbs on frontal bone, fingers supporting occiput

questions.question: Which suture runs along the midline of the skull?
What is another term for the cranial vault?
Which of the following is NOT a typical benefit associated with cranial vault techniques?
What is the primary purpose of the sphenoid decompression technique?
choices: To influence the entire craniosacral system
To release tension in the jaw
questions.answer: To influence the entire craniosacral system

questions.question: Which cranial bone forms the forehead?
What is the primary action in the parietal lift technique?
Which of the following is NOT a key bone in the cranial vault?
What is the primary belief underlying cranial vault techniques?
choices: The skull is completely rigid and immovable
Restrictions in cranial sutures can lead to health issues
The brain can be directly manipulated through the skull
Cranial bones should be forcefully realigned
questions.answer: Restrictions in cranial sutures can lead to health issues

questions.question: Which traditional Timorese belief aligns with the importance of cranial techniques?
choices: The head is the seat of the soul
The feet are the most important part of the body
The stomach is the center of all healing
The hands contain all the body's energy
questions.answer: The head is the seat of the soul

questions.question: What is the correct hand placement for the sphenoid decompression technique?
choices: Fingertips at greater wings of sphenoid
questions.answer: Fingertips at greater wings of sphenoid

questions.question: Which condition is NOT typically associated with frontal lift techniques?
What is the primary action in temporal bone techniques?
Which of the following is a key consideration when adapting cranial vault techniques for Timorese culture?
choices: Using local terms to explain concepts when possible
questions.answer: Using local terms to explain concepts when possible

questions.question: What is the primary purpose of the practical technique assessment in this module?
choices: To evaluate students' ability to perform cranial vault techniques
To assess students' ability to diagnose conditions
questions.answer: To evaluate students' ability to perform cranial vault techniques

questions.question: Which of the following is NOT a criterion for the practical technique assessment?
choices: Ability to follow and enhance craniosacral rhythm

questions.question: What is the primary goal of integrating local healing practices with cranial vault techniques?
choices: To create a more culturally appropriate and effective treatment approach
To prove the superiority of craniosacral therapy
questions.answer: To create a more culturally appropriate and effective treatment approach
